text: I remember as a kid being impressed by Mario's sleeping animation during the ending. I know that Nintendo went with the twist that Mario was dreaming all along to separate this game's world based on Doki Doki Panic from the Mario canon world, but I feel like they should just embrace it now. Did you realize Shy Guys have never made any other appearance in the mainline series where you directly control Mario? It seems crazy. I wonder if Nintendo will ever bring the SMB2 style to Mario Maker because of that.
author: SupraDarky

text: Spoiler! J/k, but you saying that reminded me of the minigame Shy Guy Says in Mario Party, it was one of my favorite minigames. I doubt a SMB2 style will ever appear in Mario Maker though.
author: Fernando Fernandez

text: Shy Guys are in Mario 64 and a lot of Mario RPGs :)

text: @lightsideluc Parakoopas are Koopas and Fly Guys are Shy Guys :D They only have a fucking propeller on their heads. If Peach wears a red Dress she's not Red-Peach and a different person. :D

text: This is sort of dumb but some years ago i found this game in one of my old drawers with the manual. The story, according to the manual, is that mario went into long dream... and long story short, he has to save "subcon" which i guess is his subconciousness?
author: pareku

text:
@SupraDarky
LIES!!! 
Super Mario RPG's and Mario 64  had Shy guys and tons of main Mario games had them too.
If you are trying to show off knowledge about the franchise at least do it right ffs.
author: Bartosz Skorupa

text: @Bartosz Skorupa calm down. :D
author: YOUr zahnpastaTUBE

text: Mario RPGs are not part of the mainline series. True there were Fly Guys in Mario 64, but I really had in mind just the normal Shy Guys. In the end though, even including Fly Guys, the point is that they are so popular that it's surprising to see how little representation they actually do get (in the mainline series).
author: SupraDarky

text: @Bartosz Skorupa 1) Mario RPG is not a mainline Mario game in the same way that Paper Mario and Mario and Luigi are not mainline games. 2) The shy guys in Mario 64 are not actually shy guys but snifits, a completely different enemy. 3) Please be more considerate when trying to debunk someone's harmless fun facts. Thanks!
author: Speedwagon is Best Girl

text: So shy guys are technically non-canonical?  That is pretty crazy!
author: PsychadelicoDuck

text: I might be wrong about this, but weren't all the enemies in Super Mario Bros 2 designed the exact same and had the same names in Doki Doki Panic? Meaning that Shy Guys aren't technically "Mario" characters, since as we all know Doki Doki came out first. Obviously nowadays Birdo and Shy Guys and the rest are recognized as Mario characters, but they originally weren't. Like I said idk maybe I'm completely wrong.
